intro: Ecbolium acuminatissimum, commonly known as the sharp-pointed ecbolium, is a rare and specialized plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, compound leaves that are often finely divided. The plant produces tiny, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
